alert.note: Alert for Cambria; Somerset (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 13 at 5:42AM EST until January 13 at 9:00PM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West-Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts of 55 to 60 mph expected, especially late this morning through early this evening. The stronger wind gusts will gradually decrease later tonight. * WHERE...Cambria and Somerset Counties. * WHEN...Through 9 PM EST this Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Scattered power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The West-Southwest wind gusts will likely increase again Sunday morning, topping 45 mph for a brief period as a secondary cold front brings true arctic air into the region, possibly accompanied by a band of dangerous snow squalls and requiring another Wind Advisory or High Wind Warning.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive. For high wind safety information, visit weather.gov/wind. The latest forecast information can be found on the NWS State College Facebook page and Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or on the web at weather.gov/ctp.
